solution_line_template: Each dress takes {fabric_per_dress} square meters of fabric to make, so the number of dresses she can make will be {total_fabric}/{fabric_per_dress} = <<{total_fabric}/{fabric_per_dress}={num_dresses}>>{num_dresses} dresses.

Each dress takes {hours_per_dress} hours to make, thus she will have to work {num_dresses} dresses x {hours_per_dress} hours/dress = <<{num_dresses}*{hours_per_dress}={total_work_hours}>>{total_work_hours} hours.
